title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: This river I have fished, both at Newburgh and Ellon, but with little success ; at the latter place I was annoyed by large soul salmon, and at the former, I remember, we enjoyed the famous dish of crappit heads, in company with the minister of Foveran, whose company is equally good, whether at a song, a strathspey, or a sermon.

title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: Gladly departing from Errol, after a stay whichour horses alone required or enjoyed, we proceeded through the well-wooded grounds of Mr. Allan,to the little vUlage of St. Madoes, where lay theHawk-stone, and whence we commanded a goodview of the town of Newburgh, and of the picturesque ruins of Lindores Abbey, in an orchard onthe opposite bank of the Tay.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Lilhgow, Callendar,Newburgh, Sinclair, Sir James laickhart of Lee, and Blackhall ; aud the report was.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: I remember Ladhope, MountBenger, Newhouse, and Newburgh being in thisstyle.
